definition: to betray one's country
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
surname Guo
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
traitor
treason

sentences.english: The traitor was captured trying to escape from the country.
sentences.chinese: 那个卖国贼在企图逃离这个国家时被逮捕。

sentences.english: If you're buying Chinese crap at Wal-Mart you are being unpatriotic.
sentences.chinese: 你要是去沃尔玛买东西，你就是卖国贼。

sentences.english: The traitors were spat on and cursed by the people.
sentences.chinese: 这一卖国贼营垒是中国人民的死敌。

sentences.english: The traitor in strait straight forwardly told me the traits of the bait.
sentences.chinese: 海峡里的卖国贼直接主动地告诉了我饵的特性。

sentences.english: Apparently, the White House thinks that the Foreign Office is full of pinkos and traitors.
sentences.chinese: 白宫认为外交部都是些左倾份子和卖国贼。

sentences.english: If you were in his shoes, what could you do?
sentences.chinese: 都说李鸿章卖国，可他又有什么能耐呢？

sentences.english: The traitor deserves ill of his country.
sentences.chinese: 卖国贼应受国家的惩罚。

sentences.english: I have cherished meeting these selfless patriots and their families.
sentences.chinese: 我特别珍惜美国不妨具有这些无私的卖国者及其家庭。

sentences.english: How to process these separatist monks of the Dalai Clique.
sentences.chinese: 达赖集团的恶僧卖国贼该当何罪？

sentences.english: From then on he was branded as traitor.
sentences.chinese: 从那以后他被加上卖国贼的污名。

sentences.english: The latter are truly traitors as are the politicians on the USA that helped this.
sentences.chinese: 后者和帮助他们的美国政客一样，都是真正的卖国贼。

sentences.english: Whoever will betray his country to the enemy will be condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 不论谁卖国投敌将会被判死刑。

sentences.english: This camp of traitors are deadly enemies of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 这一卖国贼营垒是中国人民的死敌。

sentences.english: Does Langping guidance USA female vollyball, that is quislism?
sentences.chinese: 郎平执教美国女排，是在“卖国”？

definition: traitor
treason
traitor (to China)
traitor to the nation
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to act as accomplice to the tiger/to help a villain do evil (idiom)
breaking faith and abandoning right (idiom); to betray/treachery/perfidy
to go over to the enemy/to defect
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
to go against the tide (idiom); to do things all wrong/to try to turn back history/a perverse way of doing things
rebels and traitors (idiom)/general term for scoundrel
lit. to acknowledge the bandit as one's father (idiom); fig. a complete betrayal/to sell oneself to the enemy
rebellious minister
a treacherous court official/a minister who conspires against the state
ambition of wild wolves (idiom); rapacious designs
to dupe one's sovereign
